articles.title: About this site
articles.description: This site explores urban and rural areas in the US, and compares it with poverty levels.
articles.contents:
About me
My name is Soham Gunturu and I am a rising junior in
New Albany, Ohio. I love basketball and taekwondo, and I am involved
with many different clubs at my school such as science olympiad, JSA,
and others! ## What is this site about? This site explores urban and
rural areas in the US, and compares it with poverty levels.

articles.title: Pattern between urban/rural areas and poverty
articles.description: This website will explore many different relationships between mortality rate of babies/toddlers and various variables
articles.contents:
This graph will examine how the mortality rate of children under five
changes as time progresses. The following graph shows an inverse
relationship. This makes sense because as we become more modern, so does
our technology and medical services. With better medical services, we
are able to save more children from death.



This graph will examine how the mortality rate of children under five
changes in different countries. The United States is a 1st world
country, China is a 2nd world country, and India is a third world
country. The following graph provides evidence that higher world
countries have less death and vice versa. This makes sense because
technologically advanced countries can provide better medical assistance
in saving these children.



“This graph will examine how the mortality rate of children under five
changes in different socioeconomic classes. As income increases, death
count decreases. This makes sense because higher income families can
afford better care for their children.”

articles.contents: This will describe what sources were used in this analysis
